component.text: Use this activity to check your understanding of the main points in this chapter.

• A series of questions will be presented. This is not a quiz and your answers are not recorded.
  • Click Answer to see the answer.
  • Click Next Question to go to the next question in the series.

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you're correct.
1) What is the routing algorithm used by EIGRP?

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you’re correct.
No, EIGRP sends bounded updates, only the routing information that is needed and only to those routers that need it.

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you’re correct.
3) What command can be used to verify that EIGRP has established relationships with its directly connected neighbors?
After verifying that all necessary interfaces are active with the show ip interface brief command, verify and troubleshoot a RIP configuration with the following commands:

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you’re correct.
4) What metrics does the EIGRP composite metric use? Which ones are used by default?
Bandwidth, delay, reliability and load. Only bandwidth and delay are used by default.

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you’re correct.
When the neighbor's reported distance (RD) to a network is less that this router's feasible distance to the same destination network.

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you’re correct.
6) Does EIGRP use automatic summarization similar to RIP? If so, how can it be disabled?
Yes. Automatic summarization can be disabled using the no auto-summary command.

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you’re correct.
7) When enabling EIGRP with the router-mode command, router eigrp autonomous-system, what are the requirements regarding the autonomous-system parameter?
The autonomous system needs to be the same on all routers in the EIGRP routing domain. The autonomous system number does not need to be an actual AS number.

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you’re correct.
8) Below is output from the show ip eigrp topology command. Does this output show a feasible successor? How can you tell?
Yes, 172.16.3.1 is a feasible successor. This is because the RD of 2169856 is less than the successor 192.168.10.10 FD of 3523840.

Can you mentally answer this question?
Click Answer to see if you’re correct.
9) Why is a null0 summary route sometimes automatically included by EIGRP?
A null0 summary route is automatically added to the routing table by EIGRP when there is at least one child route with a routing source of EIGRP and the default auto-summary command is used.
This concludes this chapter's Problems and Discussion questions.
